subject: Travel
title: Women of the Silk Road
description: A short lesson to help you apply Women of the Silk Road.

hook.text: History books focus on male travelers, but women shaped the Silk Road in powerful ways.

buildup.text: Sogdian women managed trading houses while their husbands traveled. They controlled the finances.

discovery.text: Princess Wencheng carried Buddhism from China to Tibet in 641 AD as part of a marriage alliance.

twist.text: A letter found in Dunhuang was from a Sogdian wife furious at her husband for abandoning her.

climax.text: She wrote: 'I'd rather be a dog's wife than yours.' It's the oldest angry letter we have.

punchline.text: Ancient women left their voices on the road too.

quiz.question: What role did Sogdian women play in Silk Road trade?
options: They managed trading houses and finances
